name: lab journal-Higgs
description: Stamped with at least a dozen security labels, this textbook-sized book houses the technical specifications and blueprints for several devices and tools mentioning the 'subprime planes.'  Some of the notes written in the margins have... frightening portent.

name: extradimensional pack
description: An unfathomably complicated machine held by sturdy faux-leather straps, meant to be worn like a backpack.  A hatch on the top can be used to store items in an extradimensional space.  How this works without annihilating spacetime isn't quite clear, but internal safeties restrict the amount stored to a modest amount.

name: m/e interface
description: This small vehicle-mounted computer terminal uses experimental technology to maintain a link to a pocket dimension.  Even though the uses of such a thing are innumerable, the technology was in its infancy, according to the book you got it from, and the Cataclysm ensured that it never developed beyond its current state.  Even so...

name: vacuum turbine
description: A sleek steel surface conceals experimental technology capable of harnessing the power of the subprime.  Its energy output is staggering, and it has no clear exhaust, but something about it caused its pioneers to ensure it never saw the light of day.  Whatever that reason is, who cares now?
